content: when tree is closed you get the following message ...
:evergreen_tree: The tree is currently closed for pull requests below priority 1000, this pull request will be tested once the tree is reopened
I wonder if we could add some information about the reason why it was closed
Maybe by placing a link there to the issue where the close tree order was executed or something like that
@Santiago Pastorino I think that's been requested a few times. There is https://github.com/rust-lang/homu/issues/57
You can currently find it from the homu queue page.
:+1: good to know :)
i was wondering if we could also have a "Tree closed" thread here where in people report every time the tree is opened/closed
